translated: If one were to understand the meaning and the Dhamma of even one of these questions and to practice in accordance with the Dhamma, one would go beyond aging and death.
“These things lead to the further shore.”
That is why this Dhamma instruction is called “The Pārāyana.”
Ajita, Tissa, and Meṇḍaka,
Puṇṇaka, and then Mettagū;
Dhota, Upasīva,
Nanda, and then Hemaka,
The two Todeyyas,
and the wise Jatukaṇṇī;
Bhadrāvudha, Udaya,
and the brahmin Posāla,
The wise Mogharāja,
and the great seer Piṅgiya—
These approached the Buddha,
the sage whose conduct was complete.
Asking subtle questions,
they approached the best of Buddhas.
The Buddha answered them,
the questions that were asked, in accordance with the truth.

the Visionary, the Kinsman of the Sun.
